stance_1: I choose food based on what I want
stance_2: I eat chicken and fish regularly
justification: Choosing food based on desire supports regular consumption of preferred meats like chicken and fish.

stance_1: I choose food based on what I want
stance_2: I eat meat with most meals
justification: Interviewee explicitly states that food choices, including frequent meat eating, are determined by what they want at the time.

stance_1: I choose food based on what I want
stance_2: I have never chosen not to eat meat
justification: The interviewee explicitly links always eating meat to their motivation of eating what they want, never considering abstaining.

stance_1: I choose food based on what I want
stance_2: People around me eat meat similarly
justification: The shared approach of eating what one wants plausibly contributes to the similarity in meat-eating habits among the interviewee's social circle.

stance_1: I eat chicken and fish regularly
stance_2: I eat meat with most meals
justification: The regular consumption of chicken and fish is a key component of eating meat with most meals as described.

stance_1: I eat chicken and fish regularly
stance_2: Typical diet in my area includes meat
justification: Regular consumption of common meats aligns with the typical regional diet that includes meat.

stance_1: I eat meat with most meals
stance_2: I have never chosen not to eat meat
justification: Never choosing not to eat meat directly supports the claim of eating meat with most meals.

stance_1: I eat meat with most meals
stance_2: People around me eat meat similarly
justification: Interviewee states that both they and people around them eat meat in a similar, frequent way.

stance_1: I eat meat with most meals
stance_2: Typical diet in my area includes meat
justification: Interviewee connects their own meat-eating with the typical diet in their area.

stance_1: I have never chosen not to eat meat
stance_2: People around me eat meat similarly
justification: The shared lack of dietary restriction in the interviewee's social group supports their own never abstaining from meat.

stance_1: People around me eat meat similarly
stance_2: Typical diet in my area includes meat
justification: Interviewee directly credits regional dietary norms for the similarity in meat-eating habits among their peers.
